name: Hotel Domitiana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got booked in here with a travel package and it was horrible. One of the worst places I've ever stayed. I think we were the only people in the whole place. the carpet is filthy and I had a hard time just getting past that. It's not even near anything you'd want to see so pick another place and if your package wants to book you there ask them to find another place.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs

reviews.text: Domitiana Hotel has big luminous rooms. it is comfortable, tidy and relatively not too expensive( we found it in Last minute travel for a fair price).
reviews.title: big luminous rooms

reviews.text: This place is in a nicer area of Naples- it is slightly outside the center-center (the dangerous/dirty area). I would suggest staying in Capri or Sorrento over Naples just due to the dirtyness facter.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the hotel- the staff was GREAT!! They were so friendly and nice. If you have kids this would be a great place to stay because there is an amusement park right across from the hotel.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel with truly amzing staff! We really had a very pleasant stay!

reviews.text: Pros: 1. AC (it tends to get very hot in Naples in the summer)
reviews.title: Ab Fab

description: Hotel Domitiana is a comfortable hotel located in the western area of Naples, in the exhibition centre, recently renovated, with progressive and continuous updates in structures and installations which, however, have retained unchanged the style wanted by the architect Ferdinando Chiaromonte and the designer Gio Ponti.The hotel offers its guests a three- star holiday, but with a high standard treatment, it is ideal for a high quality tourism thanks to its location and the professionalism of its staff, always attentive to customer needs. In fact, though it is located in a wooded and healthy area, it is very well connected to the old town, just a few minutes from the Metro station. In less than 10 minutes it can then be reached the most fascinating sites Not far away there are, instead, the baths of Le terme di Agnano – a place which is also famous for the hippodrome – and the picturesque area of archaeological interest of Campi Flegrei, where you can visit the Solfatara, Piscina Mirabilis, the Casina Vanvitelliana located on Lake Fusaro, the Antro della Sibilla Cumana, the arch of the Roman Aqueduct and il Tempio di Serapide.Even children and their families can enjoy their holidays in Hotel Domitiana because 20 meters far from the hotel there are the Zoo of Naples and Edenlandia playground, the largest amusement parks in Southern Italy.The hotel is also 800 meters far from San Paolo stadium hosting soccer matches of SSC. Napoli soccer team, from Pala Eldo / PalaBarburbuto, site of the main matches of neapolitan basket teams, from Scandone Pool, from CUS – Cittadella dello Sport (Sport centre) and the shooting range. Finally, it is only 500 meters far from Teatro Palapartenope / Casa della Musica and 800 meters from Arena Flegrea, both locations of itinerant concerts and performances in the neapolitan area.
